docs.snippet: Sports talk in the workplace, whether about the World Cup or the World Series, can exclude and alienate some employees....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sports talk in the workplace, whether about the World Cup or the World Series, can exclude and alienate some employees.
docs.abstract: Phyllis Korkki Workstation column argues that while sports talk in the workplace can be a strong bonding experience, it can also exclude and alienate some employees; notes that trend, prominent surrounding events like the World Cup, can be especially disadvantageous to women.

headline.main: Again at the Office, I’m a Player Without a Team

docs.snippet: FISHER--Charles Thomas III. Grosse Pointe Farms resident Charles Thomas "Chick" Fisher III, former chairman, president and CEO of NBD Bancorp Inc., died Sunday, June 15, 2014. He was 84. Mr. Fisher was born November 22, 1929, in Detroit to Charles...
docs.lead_paragraph: FISHER--Charles Thomas III. Grosse Pointe Farms resident Charles Thomas "Chick" Fisher III, former chairman, president and CEO of NBD Bancorp Inc., died Sunday, June 15, 2014. He was 84. Mr. Fisher was born November 22, 1929, in Detroit to Charles Thomas Fisher Jr. and Elizabeth Briggs Fisher and was a grandson of Charles T. Fisher Sr. co-founder of Fisher Body, which later became part of General Motors Corp., and Walter O. Briggs, who founded the Briggs Manufacturing Company, a maker of automobile bodies, and who owned the Detroit Tigers baseball team. Mr. Fisher graduated in 1947 from Portsmouth Priory School in Rhode Island; Georgetown University in 1951 and earned an MBA from Harvard University in 1953 and an honorary Doctorate from Georgetown University in 1990. He began work as an accountant with Touche, Ross, Bailey & Smart, and became a certified public accountant in Michigan in 1957. He joined NBD as an assistant vice president in 1958, became president in 1972 and chairman in 1982. He retired in 1993. Mr. Fisher was active in professional and community organizations including serving as a director of American Airlines, DTE (Detroit Edison), General Motors, Hiram Walker, American Broadcasting Company, National Intergroup, Jannock Ltd, Mackinac Bridge Authority, and the Georgetown University Board of Regents (Founding Member) and Board of Visitors (Chairman). He also was a member of the Country Club of Detroit, Detroit Athletic Club, Grosse Pointe Club, Bloomfield Hills Country Club, Little Traverse Yacht Club, St. Andrews Club, Question Club, Alfalfa Club, New York Yacht Club,The Key Largo Anglers Club, Delray Beach Yacht Club, the Links Club, Old Club, Wequetonsing Club, Little Harbor Club, Golf Stream Golf Club, Golf Stream Bath and Tennis Club, and the Yondetega Club. Mr. Fisher is survived by his wife, Margaret Elizabeth "Beth" Keegin Fisher, whom he married June 18, 1952; children, Margaret Elizabeth "Lisa" Fisher Jones (Macy); Curtis William Fisher, Lawrence P. "Larry" Fisher II (Maria Elena) and Mary Florence "Mimi" Fisher Hickey (John). He was predeceased by his son, Charles T. Fisher IV. Mr. Fisher also is survived by his grandchildren, Kristin Fisher Allen, Elizabeth Briggs Jones Coleman, Charles T. Fisher V, Curtis William Fisher Jr., Marta Cristina Fisher, John Keegin Fisher, Keegin Marie Fisher, Emily Ryan Hickey, Kathryn Keegin Hickey and Alison Briggs Hickey; four great-grandchildren; siblings, Mary Elizabeth Fisher, R.S.C.J., Fred J. Fisher II (Juelle), Jane F. McDonnell (Richard C. Tucker), Walter B. Fisher (Sandy), Sarah F. Champion (Robert) and John A. Fisher (Didi). A funeral Mass was celebrated on Thursday, June 19, at St. Paul on the Lake Catholic Church, 157 Lakeshore, Grosse Pointe Farms, MI. Share a memory at http://verheyden.org

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  FISHER, CHARLES THOMAS III

docs.snippet: Rookie Matt Shoemaker won his fifth straight decision in a starting role, C.J. Cron and Kole Calhoun homered in the second inning against Yu Darvish, and the Los Angeles Angels completed a three-game sweep of the Texas Rangers with a 5-2 victory o...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rookie Matt Shoemaker won his fifth straight decision in a starting role, C.J. Cron and Kole Calhoun homered in the second inning against Yu Darvish, and the Los Angeles Angels completed a three-game sweep of the Texas Rangers with a 5-2 victory on Sunday night.

headline.main: Angels Beat Rangers 5-2 for Weekend Series Sweep
headline.print_headline: Angels Beat Rangers 5-2 for Weekend Series Sweep

docs.snippet: After 35 starts, Juli Inkster will play what is likely to be her final round in the United States Women’s Open on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: After 35 starts, Juli Inkster will play what is likely to be her final round in the United States Women’s Open on Sunday.
docs.abstract: Juli Inkster will play what is likely to be her final round in the United States Women’s Open, after 35 starts at golf tournament; when she pulls away a curtain will fall on the era of the women’s professional golfer as the multiple-decades multitasker; she served as the model for a generation of working mothers on the LPGA Tour.

headline.main: Juli Inkster Leaves a Legacy as a Master Multitasker
headline.print_headline: Inkster Leaves a Legacy as a Master Multitasker

docs.snippet: Cybercriminals are finding new ways to breach firewalls and hold data hostage....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cybercriminals are finding new ways to breach firewalls and hold data hostage.
docs.abstract: News analysis; cybercriminals are becoming more adept at circumventing firewalls and antivirus programs; some security experts believe that companies should take more aggressive actions than the ones they currently employ, questioning whether law enforcement authorities are capable of protecting corporate networks.

headline.seo: Hackers Find New Ways to Breach Computer Security
